skills.task_description: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\.Save the concatenated file as Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder.

action_plan.reasoning: Activate the asammdf application window so subsequent UI actions target it.
Capture current UI elements and coordinates before interacting (required by workflow).
Open the Mode menu to switch to Batch processing (KB: set_mode_batch_processing).
After opening Mode menu, capture sub-menu elements so we can reliably click Batch processing (learning: must refresh state after clicking Mode).
Select Batch processing mode so batch operations (concatenate) are available (KB: set_mode_batch_processing).
Capture the Batch processing view elements (file list area, operations, buttons) before performing file-add/open operations.
Open the File menu to use Open dialog; using File->Open is more reliable than relying on an 'Add files' button that has failed in past attempts (KB: open_files).
Capture File menu options so we can click Open reliably (rule: always capture state before interacting).
Open the file selection dialog to add multiple .MF4 files for batch operations (KB: open_files).
Capture the file-open dialog UI (filename box, file list) so we can navigate to the target folder and select files. Always refresh state when dialogs open.
Focus the File name / path edit field so we can navigate directly to the target folder. This follows the open_files guidance to enter the folder path first.
Enter the exact folder path and press Enter to navigate to it in the dialog. Use the precise path from the task to avoid earlier failures caused by incorrect paths (KB: open_files).
Allow the file dialog to navigate to the folder and refresh the file list.
Refresh state to obtain the file list items now that the dialog is in the target folder (required before selecting a file).
Select one .MF4 file in the folder so we can use Ctrl+A to select all files (learning: must select a file before Ctrl+A).
Select all .MF4 files in the folder (recommended approach from learnings: select one file then Ctrl+A).
Confirm the selection and open all selected files into the Batch processing list (pressing Enter is more reliable than clicking the Open button in some failure cases).
After loading the files, refresh the application state so batch operation controls and the file list are visible and addressable.

Choose the Concatenate operation for the loaded files. (KB: batch_concatenate_files) — be aware of prior ambiguity; use the Concatenate button that appears in the Batch processing view (state refresh above helps disambiguate).
After selecting Concatenate, capture the UI elements for entering the output filename and finalizing the operation.
Focus the output filename edit field so we can enter the desired output path/name for the concatenated file (KB: batch_concatenate_files).
Enter the full output path and filename exactly as specified in the task so the concatenated file is saved in the same folder (KB: batch_concatenate_files).
Start the concatenation/save operation. Past failures showed a 'Start' button was sometimes incorrect — the correct final action is Save in this workflow (KB: batch_concatenate_files).
Verify the operation started or capture any confirmation/status messages after clicking Save.
